message_1: Suppose there are 500 students in a school, and you need to select a sample of 50 students. Use simple random sampling technique to select the sample of 50 students. What is the probability that any particular student will be selected?
message_2:
In simple random sampling, each student has an equal chance of being selected. To find the probability of any particular student being selected, you can divide the number of students you want to select (50) by the total number of students (500).

Probability = (Number of students to be selected) / (Total number of students)
Probability = 50 / 500

The probability that any particular student will be selected is 0.1 or 10%.
